etymology.description: semantic: 彡 (“decorative lines, ornament”) + phonetic: 文 (OC *mɯn).
etymology.interpretation: Pronunciation comes from the phonetic 文 (wén), while 彡 contributes the idea of decorative lines and ornamentation. Together they suggest variegated patterns and, by extension, refined, adorned expression associated with literary talent.

examples.chinese: 彣在书法课上展现才华(彣在書法課上展現才華)。
examples.pinyin: Wén zài shūfǎ kè shàng zhǎnxiàn cáihuá.
examples.english: Wen displayed talent in the calligraphy class.

examples.chinese: 作为编辑，彣喜欢钻研古籍(作為編輯，彣喜歡鑽研古籍)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi biānjí, Wén xǐhuan zuānyán gǔjí.
examples.english: As an editor, Wen likes to study ancient texts.

examples.chinese: 晚会上，彣写下了一篇优美的散文(晚會上，彣寫下了一篇優美的散文)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnhuì shàng, Wén xiě xià le yì piān yōuměi de sǎnwén.
examples.english: At the evening gathering, Wen wrote a graceful essay.
